poem:
### The Twilight of Industry 

In Hull, the giants slumber,  
steel bones rusted by cold winds  
of foreign treaties.  
Voices, unheeded, rise  
like smoke from extinguished flames—  
workers' hands stilled,  
engraving silence upon the green,  
fibers of hope unspooled  
by the heavy loom of fate.  
The world's wheel turns,  
grinding futures into the past.
